section.title: Recurring Payment
section.para: The Recurring Payment function allows payment requests made to the bank for bills from registered Payees, to be terminated.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Recurring Payment function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Remittance. Then select Recurring Payment from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the Recurring Payment function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Options
section.para: The Recurring Payment function allows access to the Recurring Payment module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu, a number of options are provided for Recurring Payment.
The following options are available for Recurring Payment.

listitem.para: Review, complete and submit Recurring Payment records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Recurring Payment records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Terminate
section.para: When the Terminate option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Recurring Payment page, it will display a list of all current recurring payments in the system.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Bank Ref, Beneficiary or Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of payments are the following:

Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the payment.
Bank Ref.
Identifier the bank uses for this payment.
Beneficiary
The Beneficiary of the payment.
Product Type
The type of recurring payment.
Ccy
The Currency of the LC.
Amount
The amount of the LC.
PAB
Is the Beneficiary an authorised, Pre Approved Beneficiary.
Transfer Date
The date of the next payment
Recurring payment
The frequency of the payment.
To select a recurring payment to be terminated, click on the System ID of the require payment and complete the termination details and click the terminate button.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Recurring Payment page, it allows a Recurring Payment request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. Edit Transactions

Edit Transactions When selected, this option will present a list of Recurring Payment requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Recurring Payment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu, it allows a Recurring Payment requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Recurring Payment requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
